aboutMe.title: About Me
aboutMe.subtitle: My name is Jan Kanovsky and I help deliver smart software solutions
paragraphs: I’m a back-end developer with four years of experience working with Java, Kotlin, and Spring Boot. I specialize in building reliable systems that improve performance, streamline processes, and ensure smooth functionality. My goal is to translate complex requirements into practical, efficient software that works seamlessly for users.

At Seyfor, I worked on a customs clearance system in a dual role as a back-end developer and business analyst, turning client needs into working features and maintaining functional documentation. At MOPET, I managed the back end of a prepaid card system, ensuring stability and smooth operation. I enjoy working on projects that have a real impact, making everyday tasks easier for users.

I’m currently pursuing my master’s degree at the Czech University of Life Sciences while studying abroad at Inha University in Korea. I’m open to remote opportunities where I can contribute to meaningful projects, grow my skills, and collaborate with teams focused on building useful, efficient software. If you’d like to work together, feel free to reach out!

experiences.description: At Seyfor, I worked on a custom clearance system, developing and maintaining key back-end functionality. I translated customer requirements into clear tasks for both the back-end and front-end teams, ensuring smooth implementation. My role also involved contributing to functional specifications and managing builds and deployments using Microsoft Azure.

At MOPET CZ, I helped develop and maintain a prepaid card management system using Java and Spring Boot. I assisted with database migration from Oracle to PostgreSQL and worked within an Agile environment, contributing to code reviews and daily stand-ups. My role also involved identifying and resolving technical issues to maintain system stability and performance.

At Seznam.cz, I handled user feedback, assisting customers with technical issues and ensuring a smooth user experience. I also worked closely with the development team, providing QA support for new features, identifying bugs, and suggesting improvements to enhance product quality and usability.

I tested a mobile banking app to make sure it worked correctly and was easy to use. I created test cases, looked for issues, and reported them to the development team so they could be fixed. My work helped improve the app before it was released to users.

universities.description: I am studying at Inha University as an exchange student in the field of Information Technologies. This program allows me to expand my knowledge in software development while experiencing a new academic and cultural environment.

I am currently pursuing a master’s degree in Informatics at the Czech University of Life Sciences, continuing my studies after completing my bachelor’s in Informatics. My focus is on advanced software engineering.

university.name: Faculty of Economics and Management, CZU Prague

universities.description: I graduated with a bachelor’s degree in Informatics, where I developed a strong foundation in software development and IT management. My thesis focused on optimal leadership of a team, exploring strategies for effective teamwork and productivity in tech environments.

projects.name: Crypto currency tracking
projects.description: A web application that fetches daily cryptocurrency prices using the CoinMarketCap API, allowing users to track their portfolio's value over time on day-to-day basis.

projects.name: Resume generator
projects.description: A web application designed to help users create professional resumes quickly. It allows users to input their details and generates a structured, well-formatted resume that can be downloaded
